source:
west ham are discussing a deal for jamaican starlet deshane beckford after he impressed on trial .
the skilful 17-year-old forward from montego bay united was invited to train with west ham 's academy earlier this month and has impressed coaches after spending two weeks with the club .
beckford also has offers from clubs in belgium .
beckford , who has been linked with a host of european clubs , is said to be one of the hottest prospects to emerge from the caribbean .
premier league outfit west ham are closing in on the signature of jamaican starlet deshane beckford
meanwhile , west ham have revealed season tickets at the olympic stadium will cost as little as £ 289 .
the hammers will have the cheapest pricing strategy in the barclays premier league in a bid to fill the 54,000 capacity stadium when they make the switch for the 2016-24 season .
summary: West Ham United is in discussions to sign 17-year-old Jamaican forward Deshane Beckford, who impressed during a two-week trial with their academy. Beckford, from Montego Bay United, has also received offers from Belgian clubs and is considered one of the hottest prospects to emerge from the Caribbean. Additionally, West Ham has announced that season tickets for their Olympic Stadium will cost as little as £289, making it the club with the cheapest pricing strategy in the Barclays Premier League for the 2016-24 season.

Beckford, a 17-year-old forward from Montego Bay United, trained with West Ham's academy and received positive feedback from coaches. He has also received offers from Belgian clubs. West Ham aims to secure Beckford's signature and has announced affordable season tickets at the Olympic Stadium, with the cheapest pricing strategy in the Barclays Premier League.

Note: The passage provided does not contain information about the pricing of season tickets for Beckford's potential transfer or the specifics of the deal with West Ham. The information about season ticket pricing is included as it is part of the passage, but it is not directly related to the core pieces of information about Beckford and West Ham's potential deal.

summary:
Here's a concise summary of the passage:

West Ham United are in talks to sign 17-year-old Jamaican forward Deshane Beckford from Montego Bay United. Beckford recently impressed during a two-week trial with West Ham's academy. He is considered a top prospect from the Caribbean and has attracted interest from other European clubs, including some in Belgium. Separately, West Ham announced that season tickets for their new Olympic Stadium will start at £289, making them the cheapest in the Premier League. This pricing strategy aims to fill the 54,000-seat stadium when the team moves there for the 2016-24 season.

In other news, West Ham has announced that season tickets for the Olympic Stadium will start at £289, making it the most affordable in the league. This pricing strategy is intended to ensure a full house when they move to their new stadium for the 2016-24 season.
